segments.text: I notice the water is just pouring out of the sink, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so quiet, like they know they’re doing something wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really reaching for that cookie jar, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if he’s ever fallen before.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I don’t want to be the one to ruin their fun.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but in here, it’s a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman turns around soon and sees what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR
